intro: Pilosella acutisquama, commonly known as the sharpleaf mouse-eared chickweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance.
